intro: Stachys cretica subsp. vacillans, commonly known as the wandering bellflower, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the mint family (Lamiaceae) and is characterized by its slender stems and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and scrublands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range in color from pink to purple, attracting various pollinators. Stachys cretica subsp. vacillans is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
